metadata.title: Structural basis to design multi-epitope vaccines against Novel

affiliation.laboratory: Department for Structural Infection Biology, Centre for Structural Systems 21 Biology (CSSB) & Helmholtz-Centre for Infection Research

abstract.text: The 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID19 / Wuhan coronavirus), officially named as 32

Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), is a positive-33 sense single-stranded RNA coronavirus. SARS-CoV-2 causes the contagious 34 author/funder. All rights reserved. No reuse allowed without permission. measures against SARS-CoV-2 infection require the design and development of 37 specific and effective vaccine candidate. In the present study, we have screened 38 and shortlisted 38 CTL, 33 HTL and 12 B cell epitopes from the eleven Protein 39 sequences of SARS-CoV-2 by utilizing different in silico tools. The screened 40 epitopes were further validated for their binding with their respective HLA allele 41 binders and TAP (Transporter associated with antigen processing) molecule by 42 molecular docking. The shortlisted screened epitopes were further utilized to 43 design novel two multi-epitope vaccines (MEVs) composed of CTL, HTL and B 44 cell epitopes overlaps with potential to elicit humoral as well as cellular immune 45 response against SARS-CoV-2. To enhance the immune response for our 46 vaccine design, truncated (residues 10-153) Onchocerca volvulus activation-47 associated secreted protein-1 (Ov-ASP-1) has been utilized as an adjuvant at N 48 terminal of both the MEVs. Further molecular models for both the MEVs were 49 prepared and validated for their stable molecular interactions with Toll-Like 50 Receptor 3 (TLR 3). The codon-optimized cDNA of both the MEVs were further 51 analyzed for their potential of high level of expression in a human cell line. The 52 present study is very significant in terms of molecular designing of prospective 53 CTL and HTL vaccine against SARS-CoV-2 infection with the potential to elicit 54 cellular as well as humoral immune response. 55 56

body_text.text: The novel coronavirus (COVID19), officially named as Severe Acute Respiratory The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus ORF10 protein has location 29,558-29,674 aa and 192 length 38 aa (NCBI protein sequence database). utilized to screen the potential CTL, HTL and B cell epitopes. The screened 215 epitopes were further studied for overlapping consensus regions amongst them. 216

The epitopes showing overlapping regions in partial or complete were chosen for 217 detailed further studies. 218 10 The chosen CTL and HTL epitopes were analyzed for their molecular 219 interaction with their respective HLA allele binders. Moreover, the chosen CTL 220 epitopes were also analyzed for their molecular interaction with TAP (Transporter 221 associated with antigen processing) transporter cavity to observe their smooth 222 nine SARS-CoV-2 proteins (Bui et al., 2006) . T cells recognize the complex 305 between a specific major MHC molecule and a particular pathogen-derived 306 epitope. The given epitope will elicit a response only in an individual that express 307 an MHC molecule, which is capable of binding that particular epitope. This 308 denominated MHC restriction of T cell responses and the MHC polymorphism 309 provides the basis for population coverage study. The MHC types are expressed 310 author/funder. All rights reserved. No reuse allowed without permission.

The copyright holder for this preprint (which was not peer-reviewed) is the . https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.04.01.019299 doi: bioRxiv preprint 14 at dramatically different frequencies in different ethnicities. Hence a vaccine with 311 larger population coverage could be of greater importance (Sturniolo et al., 312 1999) . Clinical administration of multiple-epitopes involving both the CTL and the 313 HTL epitopes are predicted here to have a greater probability of larger human 314 population coverage worldwide. 315

Sequence-based B Cell epitope prediction. Protein sequence-based method 318 "Bepipred Linear Epitope Prediction" was utilized to screen linear B cell epitopes 319 from eleven different SARS-CoV-2 proteins. The tool "B Cell Epitope Prediction 320

Tools" of IEDB server (http://tools.iedb.org/bcell/) was utilized. In this screening, 321 the parameters such as hydrophilicity, flexibility, accessibility, turns, exposed 322 surface, polarity and the antigenic propensity of the polypeptides is correlated 323 with its location in the protein. This allows the search for continuous epitopes 324 prediction from protein sequence. The prediction is base on the propensity scales 325 for each of the 20 amino acids. For a window size n, the i -(n-1)/2 neighboring 326 residues on each side of residue i are used to compute the score for the residue 327 i. The method "Bepipred Linear Epitope Prediction" utilized here is based on the 328 propensity scale method as well as the physiochemical properties of the given 329 antigenic sequence to screen potential epitopes (Larsen et al., 2006) . 330 331
Epitope conservation analysis. The shortlisted CTL, HTL and B cell epitopes 333 author/funder. All rights reserved. No reuse allowed without permission.

The copyright holder for this preprint (which was not peer-reviewed) is the . https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.04.01.019299 doi: bioRxiv preprint screened from eleven SARS-CoV-2 proteins were analyzed for the conservancy 334 of their amino acid sequence by "Epitope Conservancy Analysis" tool 335 (http://tools.iedb.org/conservancy/) of IEDB. The epitope conservancy is the 336 number of protein sequences (retrieved from NCBI) that contain that particular 337 epitope. The analysis was done against their entire respective source protein 338 sequences of SARS-CoV-2 proteins retrieved from the NCBI protein database 339 (Bui et al., 2007) . (https://mobyle.rpbs.univ-paris-diderot.fr/cgi-bin/portal.py#forms::PEP-381 FOLD) was utilized to generate tertiary structures for the chosen CTL and HTL 382 epitopes (Shen et al., 2014) . The copyright holder for this preprint (which was not peer-reviewed) is the . https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.04.01.019299 doi: bioRxiv preprint TASSER/). The I-TASSER is a tool for protein structure prediction based on the 494 author/funder. All rights reserved. No reuse allowed without permission.

The tool 495 generates three-dimensional (3D) atomic models from multiple threading 496 alignments and iterative structural assembly simulations for a submitted amino 497 acid sequence. I-TASSER works based on the structure templates identified by 498 LOMETS, a meta-server, from the PDB library. I-TASSER only uses the 499 templates of the highest Z-score which is the difference between the raw and 500 of templet proteins is based on TM-score of the structural alignment between the 508 query structure model and known structures. The RMSD is the RMSD between 509 templet residues and query residues that are structurally aligned by TM-align. 510

(https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/ModRefiner/) and 512

The GalaxyRefine tool refines the query tertiary structure by repeated 519 structure perturbation as well as by utilizing the subsequent structural relaxation 520 by the molecular dynamics simulation. The tool GalaxyRefine generates reliable 521 core structures from multiple templates and then re-builds unreliable loops or 522 termini by using an optimization-based refinement method (Ko et The copyright holder for this preprint (which was not peer-reviewed) is the . https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.04.01.019299 doi: bioRxiv preprint 24 the location of residue in the protein's 3D structure. The residues lying outside of 541 an ellipsoid covering 90% of the inner core protein residues score highest 542

Protrusion Index (PI) of 0.9; and so on. The discontinuous epitopes predicted by 543 the ElliPro tool are clustered based on the distance "R" in Å between two 544 residue's centers of mass lying outside of the largest possible ellipsoid. The 545 larger value of R indicates larger distant residues (residue discontinuity) are 546 Screening of Helper T lymphocyte (HTL) epitopes. The screening of helper T 626 lymphocyte (HTL) epitopes from eleven different proteins of SARS-CoV-2 was 627 performed based on "Percentile rank". The smaller the value of percentile rank 628 the higher would be the affinity of the peptide with its respective HLA allele 629 binders. The 33 epitopes with high percentile ranking were shortlisted ( Omega. The analysis has shown that several epitopes of CTL, HTL and B cell 728 were having amino acid sequences overlap. The CTL, HTL and B cell epitopes 729 having two or more than two amino acid residues overlap are shown in Fig.2 . body_text.text: The study revealed a significant molecular interaction between all the chosen 789 epitopes and their HLA allele binders showing multiple hydrogen bond formations 790 (Fig.3) . Furthermore, the B-factor analysis of all the epitope-HLA allele 791 complexes has also shown the epitope ligand to have stable (blue) binding 792 conformation in complex with the HLA allele molecule (VIBGYOR color 793 author/funder. FIGREF0.text: Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) has caused the ongoing outbreak of a 138 severe form of flu leading to death with a mortality rate of 3.4 %. The SARS-CoV-139 2 is a novel coronavirus associated with a respiratory disease initiated from the 140 Wuhan of Hubei province, China. The disease is highly contagious and has 141 spread to 182 countries/ Territories since its outbreak in China in December 2019 142 till 21 st of March 2020. Worldwide, as of 21 st March 2020, the total confirmed 143 cases have been reported to be 2,66,073 and total death count reported is 144 11,184 (WHO Situation report 21 st March 2020). Overall the SARS-CoV-2 145 infection has put a global emergency condition. The economic impact of COVID-mechanism and pathogenesis of SARS-CoV-2 is largely 153 unknown yet. The proteome of SARS-CoV-2 is composed of 11 structural and 154 non-structural proteins. These include polyprotein (ORF1ab), Surface protein (S 155 Protein), ORF3, Envelope Protein (E Protein), Membrane Protein (M Protein), 156 ORF6, ORF7a, ORF7b, ORF8, Nucleocapsid Protein (N Protein), and ORF10 157 (NCBI protein sequence database). The actual function and pathogenic or 158 proliferative role of these SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus proteins are largely not 159 known yet. 160 The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus polyprotein (ORF1ab) with length of 7,096 161 amino acid (aa) is composed of 16 different expressed protein viz. leader protein 162 (nsp1, location: 1-180 aa); nsp2 (location: 181-818); nsp3 (former nsp1, carry 163 conserved domains -N-terminal acidic, predicted phosphoesterase, papain-like 164 proteinase, Y-domain, transmembrane domain 1 (TM1) and adenosine 165 diphosphate-ribose 1''-phosphatase, location: 819-2,763); nsp4 (contains 166 transmembrane domain 2 (TM2), location: 2,764-3,263); 3C-like proteinase 167 (nsp5, main proteinase, mediates cleavages downstream of nsp4, location: 253); nsp10 (formerly known as growth-factor-like 171 protein, location: 4,254-4,392); nsp11 (location: 4,393-4,405); RNA-SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus surface glycoprotein (S Protein) is a 178 structural protein and acts as spike protein, its location is 21,563-25,384 aa, and 179 length is 1273 aa); The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus ORF3a protein has location 180 25,393-26,220 aa and length 275 aa. The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus envelope 181 protein (E Protein) (ORF4) is a structural protein and has location 26,245-26,472 182 aa and length 75 aa. The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus membrane glycoprotein (M 183 Protein) (ORF5) is a structural protein and has location 26,523-27,191aa and 184 length 222 aa. The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus ORF6 protein has location 27,202-185 27,387 aa and length 61 aa. The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus ORF7a protein has 186 location 27,394-27,759 aa and length 121 aa. The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus 187 ORF7b protein has location 27,756-27,887 aa and length 43 aa. The SARS-CoV-188 2 coronavirus ORF8 protein has location 27,894-28,259 aa and length 121 aa. 189 The SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus nucleocapsid phosphoprotein (N Protein) (ORF9) 190 is a structural protein with location 28,274-29,533 aa and has a length of 419 aa. 191

FIGREF1.text: act as potential vaccine candidates against the SARS-CoV-2 196 coronavirus infection. In the present study, we have screened highly potential 197 epitopes from all the above-mentioned protein and further, we have also 198 designed and proposed CTL (Cytotoxic T lymphocyte) and HTL (Helper T 199 lymphocyte) multi-epitope based vaccine candidates against the SARSthe present study on SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus, we have screened 204 potential epitopes and have designed and proposed two multi-epitope vaccines 205 (MEVs) composed of screened CTL (Cytotoxic T lymphocyte) and HTL (Helper T 206 lymphocyte) epitopes with overlapping regions of B cell epitopes. Hence the 207 proposed MEVs are supposed to have the potential to elicit both the humoral 208 as well as cellular immune response. To enhance immune response, truncated 209 (residues 10-153) Onchocerca volvulus activation-associated secreted protein-1 210 (Ov-ASP-1) has been utilized as an adjuvant at N-terminal of both the MEVs. The 211 truncated Ov-ASP-1 was chosen due to its potential to activate antigen-212 processing cells (APCs) (MacDonald et al., 2005; Guo et al., 2015; He et al., 213 2009). All SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus proteins mentioned in the introduction were 214

FIGREF3.text: ://crdd.osdd.net/raghava/toxinpred/multi_submit.php) was used to analyze 343 the toxicity of shortlisted CTL, HTL and B cell epitopes. The tool allows to identify 344 highly toxic or non-toxic short peptides. The toxicity check analysis was done by345 the "SVM (Swiss-Prot) based" (support vector machine) method utilizing dataset 346 of 1805 sequences as positive, 3593 negative sequences from Swissprot as well 347 as an alternative dataset comprises the same 1805 positive sequences and 348 12541 negative sequences from TrEMBLE (Gupta et al., 2013). 349 350 Overlapping residue analysis. The overlapping residue analysis for the shortlisted 351 38 CTL, 33 HTL and the 12 B cell linear epitopes was performed by the Multiple 352 ://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/msa/clustalo/) of EBI (European Bioinformatics 354 Institute) (Sievers et al., 2011). The Clustal Omega multiple sequence alignment 355 tool virtually aligns any number of protein sequences and delivers an accurate 356 selected for molecular interaction study with HLA allele and TAP 359 transporter. Based on the overlapping residue analysis of shortlisted CTL, HTL 360 and linear B cell epitopes few numbers of CTL and HTL epitopes were chosen 361 for further analysis. The chosen epitopes are encircled shown in Fig.2. These 362 epitopes were chosen based on partial or full overlapping sequence region 363 amongst all three types of epitopes (CTL, HTL and B Cell). The chosen epitopes 364 were further analyzed for their interactions with their respective HLA allele 365 binders and TAP cavity interaction. 366 367 Molecular interaction analysis of selected epitopes with HLA allele and TAP 368 transporter. 369 Tertiary structure modeling of HLA alleles and selected T cell epitopes. The 370 Swiss-model was used for homology modeling of the HLA class I and II allele 371 binders of the chosen epitopes (Arnold et al., 2006). The amino acid sequences 372 of the HLA allele binders were retrieved from Immuno Polymorphism Database 373 (IPD-IMGT/HLA) (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ipd/imgt/hla/allele.html). Templates for 374 homology modeling were chosen based on the highest amino acid sequence 375 similarity. All the generated HLA allele models had acceptable QMEAN value 376 (cutoff -4.0) (Supplementary table S1). The QMEAN value gives a composite 377 quality estimate involving both global as well as local analysis of the model 378 (Benkert et al., 2008). 379 author/funder. All rights reserved. No reuse allowed without permission.

FIGREF4.text: Molecular interaction analysis of chosen CTL and HTL epitopes with HLA alleles. 385The PatchDock tool (http://bioinfo3d.cs.tau.ac.il/PatchDock/) was utilized for in-386 silico molecular docking study of the selected CTL and HTL epitopes with their 387 respective HLA class I and II allele binders(Bell et  al., 2005; Duhovny et al., 388 2002; Schneidman-Duhovny et al., 2005). PatchDock utilizes an algorithm for 389 unbound (real-life) docking of molecules for protein-protein complex formation. 390 The algorithm carries out the rigid docking, with the surface variability/flexibility 391 implicitly addressed through liberal intermolecular penetration. The algorithm 392 focuses on the (i) initial molecular surface fitting on localized, curvature-based 393 surface patches (ii) use of Geometric Hashing and Pose Clustering for initial 394 transformation detection (iii) computation of shape complementarity utilizing the 395 Distance Transform (iv) efficient steric clash detection and geometric fit scoring 396 based on a multi-resolution shape representation and (v) utilization of biological 397 information by focusing on hot-spot rich surface patches (Bell et al., 2005; 398 Duhovny et al., 2002; Schneidman-Duhovny et al., 2005). 399 400 Molecular interaction analysis of selected CTL epitopes with TAP transporter. 401 TAP transporter plays an important role in the presentation of CTL epitope. From 402 after proteasome processing, the fragmented peptide of foreign 403 protein gets transported to endoplasmic reticulum (ER) through the TAP 404 transporter. From the ER these short peptides reach to Golgi bodies and then get 405 presented on the cell surface (Abele et al., 2004). Molecular interaction study of 406 the chosen CTL epitopes within the TAP transporter cavity was performed by 407 molecular docking study utilizing the PatchDock tool. For accurate prediction, the 408 cryo-EM structure of TAP transporter (PDB ID: 5u1d) was used by removing the 409 antigen from TAP cavity of the original structure (Oldham et al., 2016). 410 411 Design, characterization and molecular interaction analysis of Multi-412 Epitope Vaccines with immune receptor. 413 Design of Multi-Epitope Vaccines. The screened and shortlisted high scoring 38 414 CTL and 33 HTL epitopes were utilized to design CTL and HTL Multi-Epitope 415 vaccines(Table 1and 2). Short peptide EAAAK and GGGGS were used as rigid 416 and flexible linkers respectively(Fig.2). The GGGGS linker provides proper 417 conformational flexibility to the vaccine tertiary structure and hence facilitates 418 stable conformation to the vaccine. The EAAAK linker facilitates in domain 419 formation and hence facilitates the vaccine to obtain its final stable structure.420 Truncated (residues 10-153) Onchocerca volvulus activation-associated secreted 421 protein-1 (Ov-ASP-1) has been utilized as an adjuvant at N terminal of both the 422 CTL and HTL MEVs (MacDonald et al., 2005; Guo et al., 2015; He et al., 2009; 423 Hu et al., 2004; Hajighahramani et al., 2017; Chen et al., 2013; Srivastava et al., 424 2019; Srivastava et al., 2018).

FIGREF5.text: Design of SARS-CoV-2 Multi-Epitope Vaccine (MEVs). (A) CTL and 449(B) HTL epitopes were linked by the short peptide linker 'GGGGS'. Truncated 450 (residues 10-153) Onchocerca volvulus activation-associated secreted protein-1 451 (Ov-ASP-1) has been utilized at the N terminal of both the MEVs. The short 452 peptide EAAAK was used to link Ov-ASP-1 at N terminal. Epitopes from different 453 proteins were colored in different colors. C terminal 6xHis is designed as His tag.454 455 Characterization of designed Multi-Epitope Vaccines 456 Physicochemical property analysis of designed MEVs. The ProtParam 457 (https://web.expasy.org/protparam/) tool was utilized to analyze the 458 physiochemical properties of the amino acid sequence of the designed CTL and 459 HTL MEVs (Gasteiger et al., 2005). The ProtParam analysis performs an 460 empirical investigation for the given query amino acid sequence. ProtParam 461 computes various physicochemical properties derived from a given protein 462 sequence. 463 464 Interferon-gamma inducing epitope prediction. From the designed amino acid 465 sequence of both the MEVs potential interferon-gamma (IFN-γ) epitopes were 466 screened by "IFN epitope" server 467 (http://crdd.osdd.net/raghava/ifnepitope/scan.php) using "Motif and SVM hybrid", 468 (MERCI: Motif-EmeRging and with Classes-Identification, and SVM: support 469 vector machine) method. The tool predicts peptides from protein sequences 470 having the capacity to induce IFN-gamma release from CD4+ T cells. This 471 overlapping peptides from the query sequence and predicts 472 IFN-gamma inducing peptides. For the screening, IEDB database with 3705 IFN-473 gamma inducing and 6728 non-inducing MHC class II binders are utilized 474 (Nagpal et al., 2015; Dhanda et al., 2013). 475 476 MEVs allergenicity and antigenicity prediction. Both the designed MEVs were 477 further analyzed for allergenicity and antigenicity prediction by utilizing the 478 AlgPred (http://crdd.osdd.net/raghava/algpred/submission.html) and the Vaxigen 479 (http://www.ddg-pharmfac.net/vaxijen/VaxiJen/VaxiJen.html) tools respectively 480 (Saha et al., 2006; Doytchinova and Flower 2007). The AlgPred prediction is 481 based on the similarity of already known epitope with any region of the submitted 482 protein. For the screening of allergenicity, the Swiss-prot dataset consisting of 483 101725 non-allergens and 323 allergens is utilized. The VaxiJen utilizes an 484 alignment-free approach, solely based on the physicochemical properties of the 485 query amino acid sequence. For the prediction of antigenicity, the Bacterial, viral 486 and the tumor protein datasets are used by VaxiJen to derive models for the 487 prediction of whole protein antigenicity. Every set consisted of known 100 488 antigens and 100 non-antigens. 489 490 Tertiary structure modeling and refinement of MEVs. The tertiary structure of 491 both the designed CTL and HTL MEVs were generated by homology modeling 492 utilizing the I-TASSER modeling tool (https://zhanglab.ccmb.med.umich.edu/I-493

FIGREF6.text: average scores in the unit of standard deviation. For each target model, the I-501 TASSER simulations generate a large ensemble of structural conformations, 502 called decoys. To select the final models, I-TASSER uses the SPICKER program 503 to cluster all the decoys based on the pair-wise structure similarity and reports up 504 to five models. The Normalized Z-score >1 mean a good alignment and vice 505 versa. The Cov represents the coverage of the threading alignment and is equal 506 to the number of aligned residues divided by the length of query protein. Ranking 507

FIGREF7.text: Dong et al., 2011). TM-score generated by ModRefiner indicates the structural 514 similarity of the refined model with the original input model. Closer the TM-Score 515 to 1, higher would be the similarity of original and the refined model. RMSD value 516

FIGREF8.text: al., 2012; Wang 523 et al., 2013; Shin et al., 2014). To avoid any breaks in the 3D model 524 GalaxyRefine uses the triaxial loop closure method. The MolProbity score 525 generated for a given refined model indicates the log-weighted combination of 526 the clash score, the percentage of Ramachandran not favored residues and the 527 percentage of bad side-chain rotamers. 528 529 Validation of CTL and HTL MEVs refined models. Both the refined CTL and HTL 530 MEV 3D models were further validated by RAMPAGE analysis tool 531 (http://mordred.bioc.cam.ac.uk/~rapper/rampage.php) (S.C. Lovell et al., 2008; 532 Ramakrishnan, C. et al., 1965). The generated Ramachandran plots for the MEV 533 models show the sterically allowed and disallowed residues along with their 534 dihedral psi (ψ) and phi (φ) angles. 535 536 Linear and Discontinuous B-cell epitope prediction from MEVs. The Ellipro 537(ElliPro: Antibody Epitope Prediction tool; http://tools.iedb.org/ellipro/) method 538 available at IEDB, was used to screen the linear and the discontinuous B cell 539 epitopes from the MEVs vaccine models. FIGREF9.text: screened in the epitopes (Kringelum et al., 2012; Ponomarenko et al., 2008). 547 548 Molecular interaction analysis of MEVs with immunological receptor. 549 Molecular docking study of MEVs and TLR-3. Molecular interaction analysis of 550 both the designed MEVs with Toll-Like receptor-3 (TLR-3), was performed by 551 molecular docking and molecular dynamics simulation. Molecular docking was 552 performed by PatchDock server (http://bioinfo3d.cs.tau.ac.il/PatchDock/) 553 (Schneidman-Duhovny et al., 2005). PatchDock utilizes an algorithm for unbound 554 (mimicking real-world environment) docking of molecules for protein-protein 555 complex formation as explained earlier (Bell et al., 2005; Duhovny et al., 2002). 556 For molecular docking, the 3D structure of human TLR-3 ectodomain (ECD) was 557 retrieved from PDB databank (PDB ID: 2A0Z). The study provides dynamical 558 properties of the designed system with MEVs-TLR3 complexes with a guess at 559 the interactions between the molecules, and also it gives 'exact' predictions of 560 bulk properties including the hydrogen bond formation and conformation of the 561 molecules forming the complex. 562 Molecular Dynamics (MD) Simulations study of MEVs and TLR-3 complex. The 563 molecular interactions were further evaluated using molecular 564 dynamics simulations analysis. MD simulation studies were performed for 10 ns 565 by using YASARA (Yet Another Scientifc Artifcial Reality Application) (Krieger, E. 566 and Vriend, G., et al., 2015).The simulations were carried out in an explicit water 567 environment in a dodecahedron simulation box at a constant temperature (298K) 568 and pressure (1 atm) and pH 7.4 with periodic cell boundary condition. The 569 solvated systems were neutralized with counter ions (NaCl) (conc. 0.9 M). The 570 AMBER14 force field have been applied on to the systems during simulation 571 (Maier, J.A., et al., 2015; Case, D.A., et al., 2014). Long-range electrostatic 572 energy and forces were calculated using particle-mesh-based Ewald method 573 (Toukmaji, A., et al., 2000). The solvated structures was minimized by the 574 steepest descent method at a temperature of 298K and a constant pressure. 575 Then the complexes were equilibrated for a 1ns period. After equilibration, a 576 production MD was run for 10 ns at a constant temperature and pressure and 577 time frames were saved at every 10 ps for each simulation. The RMSD and 578 RMSF values for Cα, Back bone and all the atoms of both the MEV complexes 579 were analyzed for each simulation conducted. 580 581 In-silico analysis of MEVs for cloning and expression potency 582 Analysis of cDNA of both the MEVs for cloning and expression in the mammalian 583 host cell line. Complementary DNA of both the MEVs, codon-optimized for 584 expression in Mammalian cell line (Human) was generated by Java Codon 585 Adaptation Tool (http://www.jcat.de/). The generated cDNA of both the MEVs 586 .genscript.com/tools/rare-codon-analysis). The tool analyses the GC 588 content, Codon Adaptation Index (CAI) and the Tandem rare codon frequency for 589 a given cDNA (Morla et al., 2016; Wu et al., 2010). The CAI indicates the 590 possibility of cDNA expression in a chosen expression system. The tandem rare 591 codon frequency indicates the presence of low-frequency codons in the of potential epitopes 597 T cell Epitope Prediction 598 Screening of Cytotoxic T lymphocyte (CTL) Epitope. Cytotoxic T lymphocyte 599 (CTL) epitopes were screened by "MHC-I Binding Predictions" and "MHC-I 600 Binding Predictions" IEDB tools. These epitopes are shortlisted based on the 601 total amount of cleavage site in the protein, low IC(50) (nM) value for epitope-602 HLA class I allele pairs, and for binding to TAP cavity. 603 The 38 epitopes predicted by "MHC-I Binding Predictions" tool with the 604 highest "Percentile Rank" were shortlisted for multi-epitope vaccine design and 605 are listed in table 1. Rest 101 epitopes-HLA I allele pairs are listed in 606 Supplementary table S8. The 67 epitopes-HLA I allele pairs predicted by "MHC-I Processing Predictions" tool with the highest "Total score" are listed in 608 Supplementary

Multiple 771 sequence alignment performed by Clustal Omega at EBI to identify the 772 consensus overlapping regions of CTL (red), HTL (blue) and B cell epitopes 773 (green) amongst shortlisted epitopes. Epitopes with overlapping regions amongst 774 all the three types of epitopes (CTL, HTL and B Cell epitopes) were chosen for 775 further studies (encircled). 776 777 Epitope selected for molecular interaction study with HLA allele and TAP 778 transporter. The epitopes showing overlap amongst all the three types of 779 epitopes i.e CTL, HTL and B cell epitopes have been encircled in Fig.2 and are 780 chosen for further study for their interaction with HLA allele and TAP (Transporter 781 Associated with Antigen Processing) transporter. 782 783 Molecular interaction analysis of selected epitopes with HLA allele and TAP 784 transporter. 785

Molecular docking of chosen CTL and HTL epitopes (cyan sticks) 841 with binding amino acid residues of their respective HLA class I and class II allele 842 binders (magenta sticks). The study shows the docked complexes to form a 843 stable complex with multiple hydrogen bonds (green dots, lengths in Angstroms) 844formation. Images were generated by the PyMOL Molecular Graphics System,

FIGREF14.text: B-Factor of CTL and HTL epitope in complex with HLA class I and II 886 allele. CTL and HTL Epitopes are shown in sticks and HLA Class I and II alleles are 887 shown in ribbon. The HLA alleles are shown in gray. The regions of the epitope in the 888 complex are shown in a rainbow (VIBGYOR), the regions in blue being very stable and 889 the region towards red being relatively unstable. In the complexes shown above, most of 890 the regions of epitopes are in blue indicating the complexes to be highly stable. 891 892 Molecular interaction analysis of selected CTL epitopes with TAP transporter. 893 The molecular docking interaction analysis of the chosen CTL epitopes with the 894 TAP transporter cavity has shown a significantly strong molecular interaction with 895 several hydrogen bonds formation at different sites of the TAP transporter cavity. 896Two sites of interaction were of particular interest, one closer to the cytoplasmic 897 end and another closer to the ER lumen(Fig.5). This study confirms the 898 feasibility of transportation of chosen CTL epitopes from the cytoplasm to the ER 899 lumen which is an essential event for the representation of epitope by the HLA 900 allele molecules on the surface of antigen-presenting cells.

Molecular interaction of CTL epitopes (cyan sticks) within the 933 TAP cavity (gray ribbon/sticks) is shown. Detailed interaction between the 934 residues of epitopes and TAP transporter residues have been shown with 935 hydrogen formation shown with green dots. H bonds are shown in gereen dots 936 with lengths in Angstroms. 937 938 Characterization and molecular interaction analysis of designed Multi-939 Epitope Vaccines with immune receptor 940 Characterization of designed Multi-Epitope Vaccines 941 Physicochemical property analysis of designed MEVs. The empirical physiochemical properties of the CTL and HTL MEVs 944 are given in the table 5. The aliphatic index and grand average of hydropathicity 945 (GRAVY) of both the MEVs indicate the globular and hydrophilic nature of both 946 the MEVs. The instability index score of both the MEVs indicates the stable 947 nature of the protein molecules

A & C. The RMSD of both complexes was maintained to the 1127 above mentioned RMSD range for a given time window of 10 ns at reasonably 1128 invariable temperature (~278 K) and pressure (~1 atm). Molecular docking and 1129 molecular dynamics simulation study of all the MEVs-TLRs complexes indicate a 1130 stable complex formation tendency. TABREF0.text: Screening of Cytotoxic T lymphocyte (CTL) Epitope. The screening of Cytotoxic 267T lymphocyte epitopes was performed by the IEDB (Immune Epitope Database) 268 tools "MHC-I Binding Predictions" (http://tools.iedb.org/mhci/) and "MHC-I 269 Processing Predictions" (http://tools.iedb.org/processing/)(Tenzer et al., 2005; 270 Peters et al., 2003; Hoof et al., 2009). Both the tools use six different methods 271 (viz. Consensus, NN-align, SMM-align, Combinatorial library, Sturniolo and 272NetMHCIIpan) and generate "Percentile rank" and a "total score" respectively.273 The screening is based on the total amount of cleavage sites in the 274 protein. TAP score estimates an effective log -(IC50) values (half maximal 275 inhibitory concentration (IC50) for binding to TAP of a peptide or its N-terminal 276 prolonged precursors. The MHC binding prediction score is -log(IC50) values for 277 binding to MHC of a peptide (Calis et al., 2013). The IC(50) (nM) value for each 278 epitope and MHC allele binding pairs were also obtained by this IEDB tool. 279 Epitopes having high, intermediate, and least affinity of binding to their HLA allele 280 binders have IC50 values < 50 nM, < 500 nM and < 5000 nM, respectively. 281 Immunogenicity of all the screened CTL epitopes was also obtained by 282 (http://tools.iedb.org/immunogenicity/) with all the parameters set to default 284 analyzing 1st, 2nd, and C-terminus amino acids of the given screened epitope 285 (Calis et al., 2013). The tool predicts the immunogenicity of a given peptide-MHC 286 (pMHC) complex based on the physiochemical properties of constituting amino 287 author/funder. All rights reserved. No reuse allowed without permission. acid and their position within the peptide sequence. 288 Screening of Helper T lymphocyte (HTL) Epitopes. To screen out the Helper T 290 lymphocyte epitopes from SARS-CoV-2 proteins, the IEDB tool "MHC-II Binding 291 Predictions" (http://tools.iedb.org/mhcii/) was used. The tool generates 292 "Percentile rank" for each potential peptide. The lower the value of percentile, 293 higher would be the affinity. This percentile rank is generated by the combination 294 of three different methods viz. combinatorial library, SMM_align & Sturniolo; and 295 by comparing the score of the peptide against the scores of other random five 296 million 15-mer peptides of SWISSPROT database (Wang et al., 2010; Sidney et 297 al., 2008; Nielsen et al., 2007; Sturniolo et al., 1999). The rank from the 298 consensus of all three methods was generated by the median percentile rank of 299Population Coverage by CTL and HTL epitopes. The "Population Coverage" tool 302 of IEDB (http://tools.iedb.org/population/) was used to elucidate the world human 303 population coverage by the shortlisted 38 CTL and 33 HTL epitopes derived from 304

back_matter.text: Both the generated CTL and HTL 3D models were further refined by 1035ModRefiner to fix any gaps and then followed by GalaxyRefine refinement. The 1036 refinement by ModRefiner showed the TM-score of 0.9189 and 0.9498 for the 1037 CTL and HTL models respectively, hence being close to 1, the initial and the 1038 refined models were structurally similar. After refinement, the RMSD for CTL and 1039HTL models with respect to the initial model was 3.367Å and 2.318Å 1040 author/funder. All rights reserved. No reuse allowed without permission.

respectively. Further, both the CTL and HTL MEVs models were refined by 1041 were analyzed by the RAMPAGE analysis tool after refinement. The refined CTL 1053 MEV model was found to have 85.8% residues in favored region, 11.3% residues 1054 in allowed region, and only 3.0% residues in the outlier region; while the refined 1055 HTL MEV model was found to have 88.9% of residues in favored region, 8.9% 1056 residues in allowed region, and only 2.2% residues in the outlier region ( (mean) value i.e. the more flexible an atom is the larger the displacement from 1087 the mean position will be (mean-squares displacement) (Fig.9B, 9D) . The B-1088 factor analysis of the CTL and HTL MEVs bound to the TLR3 receptor shows that 1089 most of the regions of MEVs bound to TLR3 are stable nature in nature. The B-1090Factor analysis has been represented by the VIBGYOR color presentation with 1091 blue represents low B-factor and red represents high B-factor. Hence, the results 1092 suggest a stable complex formation tendency for both the CTL and HTL MEVs 1093 with the ectodomain of the human TLR-3 receptor (Fig.9B, 9D) . Binding Predictions). Selected high "Percentile rank" HTL epitopes with their 1257 respective HLA class II alleles binders predicted by the "MHC-II Binding 1258Predictions" tool of IEDB are listed. In-silico analysis has shown all the selected 1259 epitopes to be non-toxic (Non-Toxin) as well as they show significant 1260conservancy.

Supplementary table S11. Shortlisted B Cell epitopes (BepiPred Linear B 1263Cell Prediction). B cell linear epitopes with length of 4 to 20 amino acids, 1264 predicted by the "BepiPred Linear B Cell Prediction" IEDB tool, from eleven 1265 SARS-CoV-2 proteins, are listed here. In-silico analysis has shown all the 1266 selected epitopes to be non-toxic (Non-Toxin) as well as they show significant 1267 amino acid sequence conservancy.
